1.title: Edson Barboza vs. Terry Etim UFC 142
1.plot: If this battle between British submission artist Terry Etim and Brazilian Muay Thai machine Edson Barboza is typical of the matchups we can expect from the lightweight division in 2012, it's going to be an unforgettable year at 155 pounds.

2.title: Pat Barry vs. Christian Morecroft UFC on FX
2.plot: Respected striker Pat Barry will be in with a giant of the division when he squares off with 6-foot-6 prospect Christian Morecraft in what promises to be a memorable heavyweight scrap.

3.title: Evan Dunham vs. Nik Lentz UFC on FOX
3.plot: Evan Dunham, one of the most versatile prospects in the 155-pound weight class, will need to have his ground game on point against grappling specialist Nik Lentz, a fighter who was unbeaten in seven Octagon outings.

4.title: Fabricio Werdum vs. Roy Nelson UFC 143
4.plot: It's been six months since the Brazilian's last fight and Fabricio Werdum has been fine-tuning his skills, he returns to the Octagon for a scrap with the always-entertaining Roy Nelson at UFC 143.

5.title: Diego Sanchez vs. Jake Ellenberger UFC on FUEL
5.plot: When it comes to action, there are few more compelling figures than knockout artist Jake Ellenberger and cardio machine Diego Sanchez. Get ready for a battle for a shot at the division title.

6.title: Benson Henderson vs. Frankie Edgar UFC 144
6.plot: The most unlikely UFC champion meets the former WEC champion in a battle between two true athletes. Watch lightweight champion Frankie Edgar fight Benson Henderson.

7.title: Demetrious Jonson vs. Ian McCall UFC on FX
7.plot: See the speed and agility of flyweights Demetrious 'Mighty Mouse' Johnson and Ian 'Uncle Creepy' McCall battle for rankings in the UFC's first-ever flyweight tournament.

8.title: Brad Pickett vs. Damacio Page UFC on FUEL
8.plot: Aggressive, well-rounded vets Brad Pickett and Damacio Page plan on going to war to move up in the bantamweight division.

9.title: Mark Hominick vs. Eddie Yagin UFC 145
9.plot: Mark Hominick is motivated for his bout against Eddie Yagin, as both push to make their way up to title contention.

10.title: Louis Gaudinot vs. John Lineker UFC on FOX
10.plot: A 13 fight streak earned Brazilian flyweight John Lineker a spot in the UFC, but he's getting put to the test immediately, as The Ultimate Fighter 14's Louis Gaudinot brings more to the Octagon than just his bright green hair.

11.title: Dustin Poirier vs. Chan-Sung Jung UFC on FUEL
11.plot: Two featherweights with finishing skills in their fists and submission games clash as Dustin Poirier prepares to battle 'Korean Zombie' Chan Sung Jung.

12.title: Justin Lawrence vs. John Cofer TUF Live Finale
12.plot: TUF Live standouts Justin Lawrence and John Cofer are willing to lay it all on the line to get in to the UFC, but only one can walk away with the win.

13.title: Eddie Wineland vs. Scott Jorgensen UFC on FX
13.plot: Longtime bantamweight standouts Scott Jorgensen and Eddie Wineland will finally meet in a pivotal bout.

14.title: Sam Stout vs. Spencer Fisher UFC on FX
14.plot: In one of of the most bitter rivalries in the lightweight division, there is finally closure when Sam Stout and Spencer Fisher meet for the rubber match of their three fight set.

15.title: Wanderlei Silva vs. Rich Franklin UFC 147
15.plot: Two huge fan favorites will throw down in a rematch between two of the very best fighters in the history of mixed martial arts. One of the most feared fighters in the UFC, Brazil's Wanderlei Silva takes on the former UFC Middleweight Champ, Rich Franklin.

16.title: Forrest Griffin vs. Tito Ortiz UFC 148
16.plot: Tito Ortiz and Forrest Griffin have earned split decision wins over each other in the past, and now face each other in the Octagon to settle the score once and for all.

18.title: Bryan Caraway vs. Mitch Gagnon UFC 149
18.plot: 8-1 in his career, Mitch Gagnon has scored submissions in each of his wins, with his guillotine being particularly deadly. Strikeforce and WEC vet Bryan Caraway has seen plenty in his seven year career, and has experience and momentum on his side.

19.title: Joe Lauzon vs. Jamie Varner UFC on FOX
19.plot: Two fighters known for their exciting styles square off, as Jamie Varner and Joe Lauzon get set to wow the crowd.

20.title: Donald Cerrone vs. Melvin Guillard UFC 150
20.plot: Donald Cerrone and Melvin Guillard will go to war once the octagon door closes. The winner will emerge at the top of the heap of the 155 pound contenders.

21.title: TJ Grant vs. Evan Dunham UFC 152
21.plot: Evan Dunham and TJ Grant don't talk trash, but you won't find any fighters who want to win more than they do. Ground ace Grant is unbeaten at 155, and Dunham is also on a hot streak with back-to-back wins. Both men look to make a statement.

22.title: Stefan Struve vs. Stipe Miocic UFC on FUEL
22.plot: 6'11" human wrecking ball Stefan Struve takes on the undefeated beast Stipe Miocic in a heavyweight showdown for the ages.

23.title: Diego Nunes vs. Bart Palaszewski UFC on FX
23.plot: Diego Nunes is 2-2 thus far in the UFC and more fired up than ever to put on a spectacular performance. Bart Palaszewski is willing to stand and trade with anyone at 145lbs and has been eagerly awaiting his return to the Octagon.

imdb.plot outline: Of all the fights that took place in the UFC in 2012, only a select few can earn the title of Fight of the Night. These are the best of the best, from The Korean Zombie vs. Dustin Poirier to Mark Hominick vs. Eddie Yagin, and everything in between.
imdb.title: Fight of the Night
plot: Of all the fights that took place in the UFC in 2012, only a select few can earn the title of _Fight of the Night_ (qv). These are the best of the best, from The Korean Zombie vs. Dustin Poirier to Mark Hominick vs. Eddie Yagin, and everything in between.
